oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Window-based cell scheduling algorithm for VLSI implementation of an input-queued ATM switch
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SANTHANAM, A
KARANDIKAR, A
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: packet switch
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A method for providing bandwidth reservations in an input-buffered self-routing crossbar switch architecture is introduced and analysed. The scheme computes a conflict-free set of flows within a cell slot and achieves a link utilisation as high as 93% for uniform random bursty traffic. Simulations of the proposed algorithm have been performed for different window sizes (W = 1, 2, 4, 8) and the cell loss probability (CLP), cell waiting time (CWT) and system throughput (ST) are estimated. The VLSI implementation of the scheme is also described.
